item.title: New iMac!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:17, topic:393719”]Fair enough.

But as we’ve just talked about on IRC. Many sensible people (Who you would be wanting to aim this discussion at, ignore the idiots who buy /just/ because it is an Apple computer) wouldn’t be buying it just for the form factor. They want a combination of things:

  1. The big, big one - OSX
  2. It looks nice, yeah - you shouldn’t buy it just because it looks nice, but its always a bonus
  3. And it does have a nice form factor. I know if i were to buy one it wouldn’t matter too much, but I already have a PC that would take the majority of the room - and does all my gaming, the iMac (27") would fit on the end of my desk much easier being in the form factor it is. Which is nice.

The whole ‘add the value of an IPS display’ line is more relevant to the value of the 27" iMacs. I understand the price on Apple computers is often completely ridiculous, but the 27" iMacs I will generally defend for value, because they’re actually quite good.[/quote]

I’d agree, the biggest reason to get one would probably be OSX, however the form-factor is nice and the power consumption is only 200 watts hence why I suggested a laptop alternative, obviously not the same thing at all but I imagine you can get similar spec laptops and a decent external screen for the same price.

Can’t really argue that the 27 inch ones are better value, but only because the only people who make 27/30" IPS monitors are Dell and Apple, and they both charge out the ass for them. The thing that probably irks most people, or at least myself is that Apple charges ridiculous prices for lower end models/small upgrades(as seen here) and the higher end models are better value, but who has £1650 to spare on a computer?

Read full topic

item.title: New iMac!
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Fair enough.

But as we’ve just talked about on IRC. Many sensible people (Who you would be wanting to aim this discussion at, ignore the idiots who buy /just/ because it is an Apple computer) wouldn’t be buying it just for the form factor. They want a combination of things:

  1. The big, big one - OSX
  2. It looks nice, yeah - you shouldn’t buy it just because it looks nice, but its always a bonus
  3. And it does have a nice form factor. I know if i were to buy one it wouldn’t matter too much, but I already have a PC that would take the majority of the room - and does all my gaming, the iMac (27") would fit on the end of my desk much easier being in the form factor it is. Which is nice.

The whole ‘add the value of an IPS display’ line is more relevant to the value of the 27" iMacs. I understand the price on Apple computers is often completely ridiculous, but the 27" iMacs I will generally defend for value, because they’re actually quite good.

Read full topic

item.title: New iMac!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:15, topic:393719”][quote author=Niall link=topic=490904.msg3589902#msg3589902 date=1304524660]
£1250 for a 2.7ghz i5, 6770m 4gb ddr3 and a 1tb

£800 of parts buys you a working pc with all the little bits the imac has(keyboard & mouse, wireless etc) and a 24" led BenQ monitor, 2.8ghz i5, 6770, 4gb ddr3 and 1tb

you really have to ask yourself, is £200 to £450 for a smaller form factor worth it? if so, why not get a gaming laptop and use it as a desktop?
[/quote]

  1. Is the BenQ monitor an IPS display? If not, look for an IPS monitor.
  2. Because the massive reason that people actually buy Macs for, OSX![/quote]

the imacs on the apple uk aren’t IPS, they’re listed as TFT LED backlit

EDIT ok so the apples are IPS, you can still get anything from 21.5" to 23" IPS monitors for the same price as the 24" BenQ

Read full topic

item.title: New iMac!
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:14, topic:393719”]£1250 for a 2.7ghz i5, 6770m 4gb ddr3 and a 1tb

£800 of parts buys you a working pc with all the little bits the imac has(keyboard & mouse, wireless etc) and a 24" led BenQ monitor, 2.8ghz i5, 6770, 4gb ddr3 and 1tb

you really have to ask yourself, is £200 to £450 for a smaller form factor worth it? if so, why not get a gaming laptop and use it as a desktop?[/quote]

  1. Is the BenQ monitor an IPS display? If not, look for an IPS monitor.
  2. Because the massive reason that people actually buy Macs for, OSX!

[quote=“Mopman, post:9, topic:393719”][quote author=tL link=topic=490904.msg3589690#msg3589690 date=1304489737]
I do think it is annoying that they’re putting mobile processors in a desktop
[/quote]

Let’s face it they’re basically laptops though arent they[/quote]

But they’ve always put desktop components in them before, the last gen iMac had a desktop 4870.

Read full topic

item.title: New iMac!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

£1250 for a 2.7ghz i5, 6770m 4gb ddr3 and a 1tb

£800 of parts buys you a working pc with all the little bits the imac has(keyboard & mouse, wireless etc) and a 24" led BenQ monitor, 2.8ghz i5, 6770, 4gb ddr3 and 1tb

you really have to ask yourself, is £200 to £450 for a smaller form factor worth it? if so, why not get a gaming laptop and use it as a desktop?

Read full topic
